item.title: Large dangerous pothole, worsening., 19th January
item.description:

item.title: A lovely walk in my local park..., 19th January
item.description:
This park seriously needs some management. It is mostly being used by teenagers for smoking weed. The amount of rubbish hung on the gates at the entrance by woods road is just astounding even though the council know and can see who the culprits are. Constant dumped rubbish bag dumped takeaway containers and a woman who goes around dumping curries and other food on the floor that are toxic and poisonous to many wildlife including dogs. Pothols and raised cracked paving slabs which are a trip hazard. Dog poo allover the place, bins constantly over flowing. It is no wonder lazy people cant be bothered to keep the place looking nice when it is so disgusting in the first place. The fact that the council invested to much money in redesigning the back of the park with the new pathway yet cant be bothered to properly manage the park is southwark council allover. Hate hate hate it here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodland Trail, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
